definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: The two are inter-connected with each other and a difference between the two sides of the contradiction.
sentences.chinese: 二者是互相联系又互相区别的一对矛盾的两个方面。

sentences.english: We communicate with each other, exchange knowledge on literature.
sentences.chinese: 我们互相联系，彼此交流文学知识。

sentences.english: These two points are related and cannot be sundered.
sentences.chinese: 这两点是互相联系的，是不能分割的。

sentences.english: Note that these objects are interrelated.
sentences.chinese: 要注意这些对象是互相联系的。

sentences.english: The deepest form of communication is when you communicate to connect.
sentences.chinese: 最最深层次的交流就是你试着和其他人互相联系。

sentences.english: They link tightly and construct a spirit hall.
sentences.chinese: 它们互相联系，交融错杂，构筑了一座精神的殿堂。

sentences.english: All things are interrelated and interact on each other.
sentences.chinese: 一切事物都互相联系并相互作用。

sentences.english: Social networking exists for a reason—to reach out and touch people.
sentences.chinese: 公共网络存在的理由是为了人们之间互相联系。

definition: mutual exchange of assistance (idiom)/to benefit from each other's strengths and make up each other's shortfalls/to reciprocate with material assistance/scratch each other's back
mutually related karma (idiom); fates are intertwined/interdependent
to depend on sth for existence/dependent on
close/familiar/intimate/closely (related)/to foster close ties/to pay close attention
variant of 連接|连接[lian2 jie1]
